body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
 /kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
e2e test panic in test
**What you expected to happen**:
no panic 
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

start " [Feature:ManualPerformance] should be able to handle 3 pods per node" e2e test 
on a 3-node cluster
**Anything else we need to know?**:
panic info :
![2017-08-15 11 18 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2142864/29303051-287b4ca2-81bc-11e7-9379-540259086595.png)

After some digging find why. Because the cluster size is 3 that d is 0 in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/scalability/load.go#L520
sleepUpTo func which causes rand.Int63n panic
happy to fix this.
**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):1.7.3 
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:  bare-metal
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): ubuntu
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 16.04 
- Install tools: kubeadm
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: panic in e2e test
